diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with abdominal pain that started diffusely but localized to the right lower quadrant, accompanied by nausea, vomiting, chills, and abdominal distension. Physical examination indicated marked tenderness in the right lower quadrant. CT imaging revealed dilated appendix with mural hyperemia and adjacent stranding, consistent with perforated appendicitis, alongside signs suggestive of mild peritonitis.
